name: places/ChIJzRXA-cNYwokRQJwrCpR6edc
formattedAddress: 535 E 70th St 5th Floor, New York, NY 10021, USA
adrFormatAddress: 535 E 70th St 5th Floor, New York, NY 10021, USA

originalText.text:
Dr. Blanco is a genius!!!! My daughter was born with several different hereditary issues and is currently a patient of his.
Dr. Blanco is just a lovely person and is brilliant at what he does. He has corrected my daughter’s knock knees and also corrected Brachymetatarsia on her left foot. Both her legs and her foot are stronger than ever and she is back to cheerleading, which she loves!
My daughter will continue seeing Dr. Blanco for other hereditary orthopedic issues that he is monitoring. Dr. Blanco is very knowledgeable at what he does and I would very highly recommend him (as well as HSS) to anyone who is looking for an orthopedist for their child.

originalText.text: This was the BEST decision we made for our daughter. She had 2 curves with one being severe by the time we went to see him. We had a 1st opinion at NYU and weren't impressed by the staff or doctor's bedside manner. We did use a brace but it was too progressive. A few friends had scoliosis surgery at HSS so we went for a 2nd opinion here. My daughter felt extremely comfortable and we all agreed that John Blanco had amazing bedside manners. When a doctor speaks to a parent with reassurance that he will take care of your child like his own, that comfort comes a long way. He followed up with us every day after her 6hr surgery. The staffing at HSS is incredible, and the medical equipment was modern, and the rooms immaculate. Our 4 night stay over was very easing. His precision work on my daughters spine has given her a bright future. Top hospital for the last 12years respectively. Thank you for your amazing work!

originalText.text: Good looking office and helpful staff until you see the Doctor. Dr. Blanco just made me waste my time and money,. He can't help my 1 yr and a 4 yr. old because his practice is based on Expensive surgeries only and not treating a patient while it is preventable. My solution to the problem according to Dr. Blanco  in a disrespectful attitude.and arrogance is to buy expensive shoes my daughter because what I get is "CHEAP" and wait until my son looks or walks like a  monkey before he can do surgery when it can be prevented NOW.

originalText.text: Overall a surprisingly disappointing experience with adolescent spine care at HSS. First physician Dr Doyle did not recommend appropriate monitoring or follow up of our daughters scoliosis. She assumed the scoliosis was stable and recommended follow up be a year later. The scoliosis progressed dramatically. Very concerned, we switched care to Dr John Blanco also at HSS. He made an appropriate recommendation for a brace which, to be fair, our adolescent was only partially compliant with. His response at follow up was flippant and uncaring. As a fellow physician I understand the challenges the MDs face dealing with patients. I am also very aware of what makes up a poor bedside manner. Neither myself nor my daughter felt any sense of care from this man or trust in his concern for her wellbeing. I will regret the decision to entrust these HSS doctors for the rest of my life. To all mothers of adolescent girls with scoliosis avoid HSS. Their pediatric spine care is just not up to par. We are having a completely different experience at Columbia Orthopedics. Wish we had started with them.

originalText.text: I am a nurse and healthcare leader. I know amazing comprehensive care, and Dr. Blanco, his outpatient office team and the HSS inter-professional pediatric surgery team provided high-quality care to my daughter and our family prior to her surgery and throughout the day of surgery. Outpatient follow-up continues with Dr. Blanco and I remain impressed, satisfied and confident in the care my daughter and family are receiving.
